intro: Leandra rufescens var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular leandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters, with dark green, glossy leaves. The glandular hairs on its stems and leaves are a distinguishing feature, contributing to its scientific name.
